issue.title: On alacritty some keys are being repeated

labels.name: status:blocked-external
labels.description: Needs a third-party / external change or fix

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
### Problem

After commit 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2 some keys (for example Tab and Backspace) are being repeated. For example in normal mode, when deleting work using backspace two alphabets are being deleted.

### Steps to reproduce

build vim from master (after 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2)
Type in some sentences, insert normal mode, try deleting using backspace.

### Expected behavior

Keys are not repeated (or only one alphabet is removed deleted when using backspace)

As it used to be before commit 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2 was merged.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1444+g4fb3b57a19

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No

### Operating system/version

Linux

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.14.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

From git

body: To clarify, Neovim recently enabled the [Report Event Types](https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/keyboard-protocol/#report-event-types) mode of the kitty keyboard protocol. The specification indicates that unless the "Report all keys as escape codes" mode is also enabled (which it is not in this case), release events for Enter, Backspace, and Tab should not be sent. I haven't seen confirmation yet that is exactly what's happening here, but that seems to be the case.

Simple reproduction steps (from https://codeberg.org/dnkl/foot/issues/1892):

Run `printf '\x1b[>3u' && kitty +kitten show_key -m unchanged`, and press Enter, Backspace, and Tab.

In Alacritty 0.14.0 (22a44757) I get
```
$ printf '\x1b[>3u' && kitty +kitten show_key -m unchanged
Press any keys - Ctrl+D will terminate this program
UNIX		send_text
^M		\r    # this is the release event from hitting Enter to run the command
^M		\r
^M		\r
^?		\x7f
^?		\x7f
^I		\t
^I		\t
```

while in Kitty 0.38.1 I get
```
$ printf '\x1b[>3u' && kitty +kitten show_key -m unchanged
Press any keys - Ctrl+D will terminate this program
UNIX		send_text
^M		\r
^?		\x7f
^I		\t
```

Note: the above is with Num Lock off. I always have Num Lock on, in which case I get this in Alacritty:
```
$ printf '\x1b[>3u' && kitty +kitten show_key -m unchanged
Press any keys - Ctrl+D will terminate this program
UNIX		send_text
^M		\r    # this is the release event from hitting Enter to run the command
^M		\r
^M		\r
^?		\x7f
^?		\x7f
^I		\t
^I		\t
```

and in Kitty:
```
$ printf '\x1b[>3u' && kitty +kitten show_key -m unchanged
Press any keys - Ctrl+D will terminate this program
UNIX		send_text
^[[13;129:3u		\x1b[13;129:3u    # this is the release event from hitting Enter to run the command
^[[13;129u		\x1b[13;129u
^[[13;129:3u		\x1b[13;129:3u
^[[127;129u		\x1b[127;129u
^[[127;129:3u		\x1b[127;129:3u
^[[9;129u		\x1b[9;129u
^[[9;129:3u		\x1b[9;129:3u
```

The protocol docs are not clear on whether "lock" modifiers (Num Lock and Caps Lock) should stop Enter, Backspace and Tab from sending their legacy codes. But given that the reason for why those three keys are an exception in the first place is "to allow the user to type and execute commands in the shell such as reset after a program that sets this mode crashes without clearing it", I'd say Alacritty's behaviour of sending the legacy codes is more sensible. In Kitty, if an application crashes, I would have to disable Num Lock to be able to use the Backspace, Tab or Enter keys for recovery in the shell.

issue.title: Repeated keys

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

issue.body:
### Problem

When typing, Neovim repeats certain keys (tab, backspace) twice. This happens with
 tab completion of commands as well.

Bisected to 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2



### Steps to reproduce

nvim --clean
Press tab
Notice 2 tabs

Type backspace at end of "foo"
"foo" is now "f"

### Expected behavior

Keys don't repeat.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

commit 4fb3b57a19cb83a99d4c5489982c22d96e28e8c2

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Gentoo

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty 0.13.2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Portage

body: I am seeing the very same issue with `alacritty 0.15.0-dev`.
I remember asking about it, and got that that's how it should work, apparently not anymore...

I'd note to @gpanders if your request to some terminal results in this terminal changing spec, notifying other terminals might be not a bad idea, since I'm 99% sure that foot as well just copied behavior of kitty back in the day, the same as alacritty, since we even have a comment explaing that it's how it is, after even I tried to figure out why it was the case.

issue.title: Fix report of Enter/Tab/Backspace in kitty keyboard
issue.body:
The behavior changed and now it actually makes sense.

Fix #8385.

body: Thank you @kchibisov for the fast PR

> I'd note to @gpanders if your request to some terminal results in this terminal changing spec, notifying other terminals might be not a bad idea, since I'm 99% sure that foot as well just copied behavior of kitty back in the day, the same as alacritty, since we even have a comment explaing that it's how it is, after even I tried to figure out why it was the case.

The issue was reported to kitty in February 2024 and the spec was updated then: https://github.com/kovidgoyal/kitty/issues/7136

The issue was reported to foot at the same time as Alacritty: https://codeberg.org/dnkl/foot/issues/1892

Ghostty updated shortly after the issue was reported to kitty: https://github.com/ghostty-org/ghostty/pull/1535

I'm not aware of how any other terminals behave.

probably all behave the same as past kitty though, given that we had explicit lines for such behavior which I personally questioned in the past. Though, we don't have any sort of versioning and breaking changes (even if they obviously fix broken established behavior) can slip at any time.
Are there plans to port this fix also to v14?
No, there will be 0.15 soon with it.

NVIM v0.11.0-dev
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1703358377

alacritty 0.15.1


I am still experiencing this issue with these versions

You can try to repro with the process mentioned above, but ensure that you test in actually that actually is 0.15.1 and you don't have e.g. 0.13 that you run because it's early in the path during launch.

I'm also still seeing this issue on alacritty 15.1 and latest nightly neovim. 

Reinstalled neovim & alacritty to be 100% sure

Per repro steps above
```
Press any keys - Ctrl+D will terminate this program
UNIX		send_text
^M		\r
^M		\r
^M		\r
^M		\r
^M		\r
^M		\r
^M		\r
^?		\x7f
^?		\x7f
q		q
```
```
nvim -V1 -v

NVIM v0.12.0-dev
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Compilation: /usr/bin/cc -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/build/neovim-vWkLbm/neovim-0.11.0~ubuntu1+git202503300634-99529577cc-545c88c787=. -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -O2 -g -flto -fno-fat-lto-objects -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wvla -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -fsigned-char -fstack-protector-strong -Wno-conversion -fno-common -Wno-unused-result -Wimplicit-fallthrough -fdiagnostics-color=auto  -DUNIT_TESTING -D_GNU_SOURCE -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -DUTF8PROC_STATIC -I/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/build/neovim-vWkLbm/neovim-0.11.0~ubuntu1+git202503300634-99529577cc-545c88c787/.deps/usr/include -I/build/neovim-vWkLbm/neovim-0.11.0~ubuntu1+git202503300634-99529577cc-545c88c787/build/src/nvim/auto -I/build/neovim-vWkLbm/neovim-0.11.0~ubuntu1+git202503300634-99529577cc-545c88c787/build/include -I/build/neovim-vWkLbm/neovim-0.11.0~ubuntu1+git202503300634-99529577cc-545c88c787/build/cmake.config -I/build/neovim-vWkLbm/neovim-0.11.0~ubuntu1+git202503300634-99529577cc-545c88c787/src -I/usr/include

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/usr/share/nvim"
```
```
alacritty --version

alacritty 0.15.1
```
I know this version of alacritty has resolved the issue for others (but many still seem to have it).  Any idea what else we can try to resolve this?

THanks for any help!
